author: The Hartley Sentinel-The Everly/Royal News
title: Early leads fail to translate into wins
text:
Early leads fail to translate into wins
H-M-S can't hold off Westerners in volleyball loss
Early leads in the first two sets did not translate into wins for Hartley-Melvin-Sanborn in the final War Eagle Conference volleyball match of the season. Akron-Westfield overcame those deficits and went on to sweep the Hawks on Oct. 16 in Hartley.
The Hawks held the lead in the first set until Akron-Westfield went ahead 14-13. H-M-S rallied to force a 22-22 tie, but the Westerners pulled away for a 25-23 win.
The second set was a copy of the first. The Hawks led at the start but Akron-Westfield rallied to take a 14-13 lead. H-M-S then overcame a 21-18 deficit to take a 24-22 lead. The Westerners would score four straight points to escape with a 26-24 win.
Akron-Westfield took command of the third set, building a 12-point advantage. H-M-S narrowed the margin to 21-14, but eventually lost by the score of 25-15.
Leading the offense were Moriah Otto with nine kills, Eva Stammer with five, Hannah Tessum and Kenadie Van Loon with three each, and Jordan Lux with two. Van Loon recorded 15 assists.
Serving totals were: Stammer 14-of-15, Otto 13-of-14 with two aces, Van Loon 11-of-13, Tessum 5-of-5, Payton Diehm 4-of-4, and Lindsey Van Es 4-of-7.
Van Es paced the defense with nine digs, Otto and Stammer each had seven, Diehm had five, Lux had three, and Lexi Schmillen, Tessum and Van Loon had two. Mahkenzie Mattingly had two solo blocks, and Otto and Tessum added two assists.
H-M-S ended the regular season at 4-16 overall and 2-9 in conference play.
â€¢ Royal sweep
MMCRU swept a conference match with H-M-S on Oct. 14 at Marcus. Set scores were 25-12, 25-16, 26-24.
MMCRU recorded 36 kills and eight ace serves to pace their offense.
Otto and Mattingly led H-M-S with eight and five kills, respectively. Van Loon put up 12 assists.
On defense, Stammer had seven digs, Diehm and Van Es had six, Tessum had five and Natalie Daggett added two. Mattingly recorded two solo blocks and an assist, while Otto and Tessum each had a solo block and an assist.
Individual serving totals included Van Es 8-of-8; Diehm and Stammer 9-of-10; Van Loon 8-of-10, Daggett 5-of-5; and Otto 5-of-7. Otto had two aces; Stammer and Van Loon each had one.
